Alternative 1: 1. Before speaking, ensure the deaf person is paying attention. Try using a visual cue like a wave or a gentle tap on the shoulder.
Alternative 2: 1. Make sure the person who is deaf is aware before you start speaking. A visual signal like waving or tapping their shoulder usually works well.
Alternative 3: 1. Get the attention of the deaf person before speaking by using a visual cue such as a wave, tap on the shoulder, or another appropriate gesture.
